data.title: OLTL: FAQ 6
data.text:
FAQ 6

OTHER ITEMS OF INTEREST ABOUT

_ONE LIFE TO LIVE_

Originated: September 16, 1997

Updated: January 8, 1998 to add cat "Twister" submitted by Tina M. Wood

Last Posted: January 2, 1998

Thank you to Sandy Hudson, Tante Joan Roseman, Sandy Weeks,

Naeem Caudhry, Gregory Rayner, and Tina M. Wood for their contributions to

this FAQ.

The Characters Married Three or More Times With Strong Ties to

the Show

Asa Buchanan's Wives Victoria Lord's Husbands

Olympia - mother of Bo Roger Gordon

and Clint (not legal?)

Samantha Vernon Joe Riley

Delilah Ralston Steve Burke

Becky Lee Hunt Joe Riley

Pamela Reed Stuart Clint Buchanan

Renee Divine Clint Buchanan

Blair Daimler Sloan Carpenter

Alexandra Olanov

Alexandra Olanov Hesser

Bo Buchanan's Wives Tina Clayton Lord's Husbands

Delilah Ralston Cord Roberts

Didi O'Neal Cord Roberts

Sarah Gordon Cord Roberts

Cassie Callison Caine Rogan

Nora Gannon David Vickers

Larry Wolek's Wives Cassie Callison's Husbands

Karen Martin Rob Coronal

Meredith Lord Bo Buchanan

Karen Wolek Andrew Carpenter

Laurel Chapin

Dorian Cramer's Husbands Todd Manning's Wives

Victor Lord Blair Daimler

Herb Callison Blair Daimler

David Vickers Tea Delgado

Max Holden's Three Loves Who Were (Almost) Nuns

Gabrielle Medina

Maggie Carpenter

Luna Moody (almost the same thing. She planned to join

the "Goddess" Order.)

The Two Gangs of Angel Square

Prides and Arrows

Memorable Villains from the Show

Ted Clayton Patrick "Faux Bo" London

Mitch Lawrence Jamie Saunders

Tracey James Carlo Hesser

Ursula Blackwell Ivan Kipling

Michael Grande Elizabeth Saunders

Johnny Dee Hesser Austin Buchanan

Marco Dane Allison Perkins

Unmemorable Villains from the Show

Mr. Kenneally Michael Mahoney

Men of 21

Pets

"Moose," Todd Manning's macaw

"Mud," Bo and Nora Buchanan's dog, now Max's (formerly belonged to the

Thornharts)

"Olivera Twist" or "Twister," owned by David Vickers then C. J. and

Sarah Roberts

Puppy owned by Al Holden (name unknown).

Authors of Books Living or Having Relatives in Llanview

"Lord of the Banner" -- Sloan Carpenter

"Sense and Sensuality" -- Dorian Cramer Lord (published in Belize)

(thanks Greg)

"Sex and Your Teenager" -- Dr. Maude Boylan

"Sex and the Mature Woman" -- Dr. Maude Boylan

Movie Made by Marco Dane with Asa Buchanan's Money

"Blood Moon"

Daytime Drama--Produced by Bo Buchanan/Max Holden;

Starring Megan Gordon

"Fraternity Row"

The Six Personalities of Victoria Lord Carpenter

1. Niki (Nikki) - Party girl who liked sex (according to

Jean Randolph); oldest personality known by viewers

2. Jean Randolph -- gatekeeper, controller

3. Princess -- 7 year old child who could be intimidated

4. Tommy -- teenage boy; defender and protector

5. Tori -- for "Victoria" -- angry and revenge seeker

6. Victor -- abuser and punisher

Others with Dual Personalities

Marco Dane (Mario Corelli, brother)

Megan Gordon (Ruby Bright)

Twins

Pat/Maggie Ashley

Marco Dane/Mario Corelli

Joe Riley/Tom Dennison

Julie and Tie Siegel (fraternal)

Ian Armitage/Maggie Carpenter (fraternal)

Frankie/Lesley Holden (fraternal)

Actors Portraying More Than One Role

Pamela Payton Wright (Charlotte, 1986; Addie Kramer)

Christopher Cousins -- Cain Rogan, a.k.a. Hudson King,

Heinrich Kaiser, Humberto Kaldaron (1991-1994)

Christine Jones -- Sheilah Rafferty (1975), Viki Riley (during

Slezak's maternity leave), and Pamela Buchanan (1985-87)

Roy Thinnes -- Alex "Coronal" Crown (1984-85), Sloan Carpenter

(1992-95) (both characters had sons that married Cassie

Callison)

Anthony Ponzini -- Vinnie Wolek (1968-75, 1987),

Charlie Smith (1988-89)

Eileen Heckart -- Ruth Perkins, Wilma Berne (1992)

Susan Batten -- Luna Moody (1991-95), Deborah Pruitt (1992)

John Fiedler -- Virgil the Angel and Gilbert Lange (1987-88)

Kim Zimmer -- Bonnie Harmer (1978) and Echo DiSavoy (1983)

Erika Slezak -- Victoria Lord Carpenter (1971-present), Ginny

Fletcher (1988)

Lee Patterson -- Joe Riley (1968-1970, 1972-79), Tom Dennison

(1986-88)

Brenda Brock -- Brenda McGillis Grande (1988-1991), Mary

McGillis (1988)

Robert S. Woods -- Bo Buchanan (1979-86, 1988-present), Patrick

"Faux Bo" London (1988)

Jessica Tuck -- Megan Gordon (1988-91), new love for Jake (1992)

Thom Christopher -- Carlo Hesser (1990-92, 1996), Mortimer Bern

(1992-93, 1996)

Jacqueline Courtney -- Maggie Ashley (1979), Pat Ashley (1975-83)

Gerald Anthony -- Marco Dane (1977-86, 1989, 1990), Mario Cornelli

Philip Carey -- Asa Buchanan (1979-present), Buck Buchanan (1988)

John Loprieno -- Cord Roberts (1986-1991, 1993-97), ? McGillis (1988)

Larry Pine -- Roger Gordon (1988-1991), Randolph Lord (1988)

Crossovers Between Other ABC Shows and _One Life to Live_

Marco Dane -- from OLTL to _General Hospital_ (GH)

Jon Russell -- from OLTL to GH

Jeremy Hunter -- from _All My Children_ (AMC) to OLTL to

_The City_

Paul Martin -- from AMC to OLTL

Tad Martin -- from AMC to OLTL

Steve Hardy -- from GH to OLTL

Nora Gannon -- from OLTL to GH

Hank Gannon, Bo and Nora Buchanan, Rachel Gannon -- from

OLTL to AMC

Dorian Lord -- (by telephone) to AMC (conversation with

Adam Chandler regarding the Natalie scandal)

Dorian Cramer Lord's Distinctive Record

She has slept and married a grandfather (Victor Lord),

almost succeeded with sleeping with a father (Joe Riley),

and a grandson (Joey "Riley" Buchanan) from the same

family. Add to this, Dorian also slept with Joey's step

father, Clint Buchanan, before he married Viki (1980).
